title: Vessel with 20,000 MT of Diesel to reach SL
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Ministry of Energy stated that another ship carrying 20,000 MT of Diesel will reach Sri Lankan shores on Monday (14).
The Ministry of Energy stated that the Diesel on board the ship which arrived in Sri Lanka last Friday (11) is now being distributed island-wide expeditiously.
The ship was scheduled to unload the Diesel on Saturday (12) but it was delayed because of a technical issue.
The Ministry of Energy stated that the ship was carrying 38,300 MT of Diesel.
Cut taxes on fuel, says Gammanpila while asking why SLPP is silent on price hike?
